definition: soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
soul/mortal soul, i.e. attached to the body

sentences.english: There is no your news each time, I would be frightened of don't already daze.
sentences.chinese: 每次沒有了你的消息，我都會失魂落魄的茫然不已。

sentences.english: So many, fearful, took with them their sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 這麼多的人，失魂落魄，承受着悲哀。

sentences.english: Going there we gain a day, leaving we'll lose our mind.
sentences.chinese: 飛到那兒我們賺了一天，離開那兒我們失魂落魄。

sentences.english: His wife left him last year, and he's been really frustrated since then.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子去年離開了他，從此他就失魂落魄。

sentences.english: After Joe broke up with his girl friend, he was out of it for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 自從喬和女友分手後，他失魂落魄了好幾個禮拜。
你看起來有點失魂落魄的。

sentences.english: During he whole of this time, Scrooge had acted like a man out of his wits.
sentences.chinese: 在整個這段時間內，斯克魯吉像是失魂落魄似的。

sentences.english: That day I was a wreck wondering how she would react to it.
sentences.chinese: 那一天我失魂落魄，不知道她會如何反映。

sentences.english: Her mother's voice in the corridor roused her from an angry trance.
sentences.chinese: 她氣得失魂落魄，是她媽媽在走廊裏的聲音喚醒了她。

sentences.english: They're moving, but listlessly and not purposefully.
sentences.chinese: 他們移動，但失魂落魄並豪無目的。

definition: to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
listless/dispirited/washed out/also written 沒精打彩|没精打彩
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
